medical_history.chief_complaint: Painless and progressive mutilating distal ulcerations leading to amputation and joint deformity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Onset occurred in the first decade of life. Symptoms began with painless ulcerations, leading to further complications such as amputation and joint deformity. Sensitivity to pain, touch, and vibration was progressively reduced. Autonomic disturbances included hypohidrosis and gastrointestinal dysfunction.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hereditary sensory autonomic neuropathy type VI (HSAN-VI), associated with two novel mutations in the dystonin (DST) gene.
medical_history.family_history: The family consisted of three affected siblings with no other family members affected. Parents were described as nonconsanguineous and healthy.
